posts.cooked:

posts.cooked: How was it working with YAGSL?

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: To be honest, it‚Äôs been frustrating us for months. There‚Äôs no known-working configuration for our hardware, so messing with configuration to get it working was tough. It‚Äôs still not fully working, so if you‚Äôd like to help us debug, please send a private message to Josh @gdgr , one of our software mentors.

posts.name: Daniel C.
posts.cooked: For a sec I thought you guys were mechanical advantage and I was so confused when I saw YAGSL; nice work though!

posts.name: Alexander Hamilton
posts.cooked: I saw this post, thought to myself: ‚ÄúWow. Mechanical Advantage is making some changes‚Äù Then I double checked the number and still read 6328 then I read your post and finally understand that it is not 6328. Imagine if they were on a team together
Octagons are cool and all but they‚Äôre sturdier when they‚Äôre milled from a single solid block of 7071 aluminum
